    Initializes a 2d array of Strings Set black's and white's pieces in default position and does black/white tiling
    boolean[]
    initializeCastle()
    Initializes a boolean array with index 2 and 6 set to true Used to initialize whiteCastle and blackCastle Used to check if a castle move is legal later on
    boolean[]
    initializePassant()
    Initializes a boolean array in which all values are set to false Used to initialize whitePassant and blackPassant Used to keep track of double moves to verify if an en passant is legal

    inputParse(String input)
    Breaks input into an array of strings and checks for edge cases If a draw is offered, sets offered draw boolean to true If a piece is specified for promotion, sets the promo string to the corresponding piece
    int
    letterToCoordinate(String input)
    Translates a letter into an array index according to how a chess board is formatted

    Creates a Chess instance and calls play to start the game
    boolean
    moveApproval(int iStart, int jStart, int iEnd, int jEnd, String[][] board)
    Given a 2d array representing the board and the start and end indices, return true if a move is valid and false otherwise Does calculations based on the piece that is at the starting area to see it can move to the end block legally Does not check if the move leaves the king in check, that is done elsewhere
    void
    play()
    Logic for playing the game Starts scanner and call init to initialize data structures / fields Repeatedly prompts players for inputs until the game is ended Prints out ending message
    void

    Prints out chess board given 2d array of strings

    void
    updateCastle(int iStart, int jStart)
    Checks if a given move is from one of the 4 corners (rook) and updates the blackCastle/whiteCastle arrays to reflect the move Prevents castling on a side if the rook has been moved
    boolean
    validMove(String[] inputs)
    Given an array representing the inputs gotten from the scanner, returns true if a the move is valid First has letters translated into array indices and also translates the numbers into their corresponding array indices Then updates checkboard to reflect the desired move Then checks if the desired move is valid

  • Constructor Details

    • Chess

      public Chess()

  • Method Details

    • checkMate

      public boolean checkMate()
      Checks if any valid move results in the current player not being in checkmate. Current player is known based on the white field which is true if it's white's turn and false if it's black's
      Returns:
      if the current player is in checkmate

    • check

      public boolean check(String[][] checkBoard)
      Checks if the current player is in check on a given board
      Parameters:
      checkBoard - The board in which the program will check for a check
      Returns:
      if the current player is in check

    • initializeCastle

      public boolean[] initializeCastle()
      Initializes a boolean array with index 2 and 6 set to true Used to initialize whiteCastle and blackCastle Used to check if a castle move is legal later on
      Returns:
      boolean array with index 2 and 6 set to true

    • initializePassant

      public boolean[] initializePassant()
      Initializes a boolean array in which all values are set to false Used to initialize whitePassant and blackPassant Used to keep track of double moves to verify if an en passant is legal
      Returns:
      8 length boolean array with all values set to false

    • initializeBoard

      public String[][] initializeBoard()
      Initializes a 2d array of Strings Set black's and white's pieces in default position and does black/white tiling
      Returns:
      Chess board in the form of a 2d array of strings

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard(String[][] board)
      Prints out chess board given 2d array of strings
      Parameters:
      board - the chess board that is printed out

    • letterToCoordinate

      public int letterToCoordinate(String input)
      Translates a letter into an array index according to how a chess board is formatted
      Parameters:
      input - the given letter for a move
      Returns:
      the letter's corresponding array index

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard()
      Updates the board 2d array to be the same as the 2d array checkBoard

    • syncBoards

      public void syncBoards(String[][] copy, String[][] paste)
      Takes a 2d array "copy" and copies all its data into another 2d array "paste"
      Parameters:
      copy - 2d array that will be copied from
      paste - 2d array that will be copied into

    • updateCastle

      public void updateCastle(int iStart, int jStart)
      Checks if a given move is from one of the 4 corners (rook) and updates the blackCastle/whiteCastle arrays to reflect the move Prevents castling on a side if the rook has been moved
      Parameters:
      iStart - i index of 2d array ex. board[i][j]
      jStart - j index of 2d array ex. board[i][j]

    • moveApproval

      public boolean moveApproval(int iStart, int jStart, int iEnd, int jEnd, String[][] board)
      Given a 2d array representing the board and the start and end indices, return true if a move is valid and false otherwise Does calculations based on the piece that is at the starting area to see it can move to the end block legally Does not check if the move leaves the king in check, that is done elsewhere
      Parameters:
      iStart - i index of piece ex. board[i][j]
      jStart - j index of piece ex. board[i][j]
      iEnd - i index of requested ending spot ex. board[i][j]
      jEnd - j index of requested ending spot ex. board[i][j]
      board - 2d string array in which all calculations will be done on
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid false otherwise

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove(String[] inputs)
      Given an array representing the inputs gotten from the scanner, returns true if a the move is valid First has letters translated into array indices and also translates the numbers into their corresponding array indices Then updates checkboard to reflect the desired move Then checks if the desired move is valid
      Parameters:
      inputs - String array representing the inputs given ex. e2 e4
      Returns:
      whether or not the move is valid

    • inputParse

      public boolean inputParse(String input)
      Breaks input into an array of strings and checks for edge cases If a draw is offered, sets offered draw boolean to true If a piece is specified for promotion, sets the promo string to the corresponding piece
      Parameters:
      input - String representing the next line gotten by the scanner
      Returns:
      true if the moves reflected by the input are ultimately valid

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes data structures / fields

    • play

      public void play()
      Logic for playing the game Starts scanner and call init to initialize data structures / fields Repeatedly prompts players for inputs until the game is ended Prints out ending message

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Creates a Chess instance and calls play to start the game
      Parameters:
      args - Not used
